meanings.definition: To replant trees in (an area) that has been cleared of trees.
meanings.sent1: After the fire, the volunteers worked hard to reforest the burnt forest.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reforest areas that have been deforested to maintain a healthy ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels decided to reforest their nut stash after the hungry chipmunks raided it.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a gentle rain, helping to reforest the barren land of his heart.
meanings.sent5: The magic of nature lies in its ability to reforest and renew itself after destruction.

meanings.definition: The process of replanting trees in an area that has been cleared of trees.
meanings.sent1: The reforest of the national park was a success, thanks to the dedicated conservationists.
meanings.sent2: Many environmental organizations focus on the reforest of deforested lands.
meanings.sent3: The annual tree-planting event turned into a friendly reforest competition among the participants.
meanings.sent4: The reforest of memories in her mind brought back the lush greenery of her childhood.
meanings.sent5: The reforest of hope in the community brought new life and vitality to the once barren area.
